article_headline: Time to grow up at Children s Center as debt restructuring begins
article_text: After less than a full year of operation, the ASI Children’s Center found itself last July more than $200,000 in debt. Since then, many have been left wondering just where it went wrong. For those who have sorted through the finances, it’s clear: planners expected to have it all — full occupancy and the fees that come along with it. The Center also was dependent on high enrollment and a portion of the ASI fees each student pays. But university enrollment has decreased and the Center has not filled with children.
